tit.e: Keiji (collective term of Kyoto and Shiga Prefectures and Kyoto City)
Keiji (collective term of Kyoto and Shiga Prefectures and Kyoto City)

sen.j: 京滋（けいじ）とは京都府もしくは京都市（以下、「京都」と表記）と滋賀県（以下、「滋賀」と表記）をあわせた地域のことを指す呼び名である。
sen.e: Keiji' referrs to the area made up of Kyoto Prefecture or Kyoto city (hereinafter, collectively written as 'Kyoto') and Shiga Prefecture (hereinafter, written as 'Shiga').
Keiji refers to the area made up of Kyoto Prefecture or Kyoto City (hereinafter, collectively written as 'Kyoto') and Shiga Prefecture (hereinafter, written as 'Shiga').
Keiji refers to the area made up of Kyoto Prefecture or Kyoto City (hereinafter, collectively written as 'Kyoto') and Shiga Prefecture (hereinafter, written as 'Shiga').

tit.j: 京都と滋賀のつながり
tit.e: The connection between Kyoto and Shiga
The connection between Kyoto and Shiga
The connection between Kyoto and Shiga

sen.j: 京都と滋賀の間には昔から交通の大動脈である東海道が整備されており、加えて琵琶湖・淀川（瀬田川）の水路もあり、結びつきが強かった。
sen.e: The connection between Kyoto and Shiga has been strong because 'Tokaido Road', the very important aorta-like road for transportation, has been in good condition between Kyoto and Shiga since old time, in addition to the water route from Lake Biwa through the Yodo-gawa river (the Seta-gawa river).

The connection between Kyoto and Shiga has been strong because of Tokaido Road, the very important aorta-like road for transportation, which has been set through them since ancient times, in addition to the water route from Lake Biwa through the Yodo-gawa river (which is called as the Seta-gawa river in this area).

The connection between Kyoto and Shiga has been strong because of Tokaido Road, the very important aorta-like road for transportation, which has been set through them since ancient times, in addition to the water route from Lake Biwa through the Yodo-gawa River (which is called as the Seta-gawa River in this area).
sen.cmt: the Yodo-gawa river→the Yodo-gawa Riverthe Seta-gawa river→the Seta-gawa River

sen.j: 明治維新後も、東海道本線（琵琶湖線）や京阪京津線、国道1号、東海道新幹線、名神高速道路などの鉄道・道路交通が日本国内でも比較的早期に整備されている。
sen.e: After Meiji Restoration, railways and roads were built relarively in earlier days, including JR Kyoto Line (Tokaido Main Line) (JR Biwako Line), Keihan Keishin Line, National Route 1, Tokaido Shinkansen and Meishin Expressway.

After Meiji Restoration, railways and roads were built relatively in earlier days than other parts of Japan, including Tokaido Main Line (Biwako Line), Keihan Keishin Line, National Route 1, Tokaido Shinkansen and Meishin Expressway.

After Meiji Restoration, railways and roads were built relatively in earlier days than other parts of Japan, including Tokaido Main Line (Biwako Line), Keihan Keishin Line, National Route 1, Tokaido Shinkansen and Meishin Expressway.

sen.j: 現在では滋賀県の住民が琵琶湖線や湖西線などを利用して京都市へ多く通勤・通学しており、一体的な都市圏（京都都市圏）を形成している。
sen.e: A lot of residents in Shiga Prefecture commute to Kyoto city using JR Biwako Line and/or Kosei Line, which results in forming a unified urban area (Kyoto urban area).
A lot of residents in Shiga Prefecture commute to Kyoto City using Biwako Line or Kosei Line and so on, which results in forming a unified urban area (Kyoto urban area).
A lot of residents in Shiga Prefecture commute to Kyoto City using Biwako Line or Kosei Line and so on, which results in forming a unified urban area (Kyoto urban area).

sen.j: むしろ、京都府北部（綾部市、福知山市以北）より滋賀県域のほうが京都市との結びつきが強い。
sen.e: Shiga area is more strongly connected with Kyoto city than the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (areas north of Ayabe city or Fukuchiyama city) is.
Shiga Prefecture is more strongly connected with Kyoto City than the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (areas north of Ayabe City or Fukuchiyama City) is.
sen.cmt: 表記などを変えました。
sen.e: Shiga Prefecture is more strongly connected with Kyoto City than the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture (areas north of Ayabe City or Fukuchiyama City) is.

sen.j: 滋賀県の京都に本社を置く企業や、他の都市に本社を置く大手企業の京都支店は、しばしば滋賀をも含んだ領域を営業エリアとすることがある。
sen.e: Some companies that have their central offices in Kyoto and develop their business activities in Shiga, and Kyoto branches of big enterprise that have their central officies in other cities often regard areas including Shiga as their business area.

Companies in Shiga Prefecture with their headquarters in Kyoto, and Kyoto branches of big enterprises with their headquarters in other cities often regard areas including Shiga as their business area.

Companies in Shiga Prefecture with their headquarters in Kyoto, and Kyoto branches of big enterprises with their headquarters in other cities often regard areas including Shiga as their business area.

sen.j: 1980年代以降、逆に滋賀に本社を置く企業が京都に進出するケースも目立っている。
sen.e: Since 1980's, some companies with their central officies in Shiga have developed their business activities into Kyoto.
On the contrary, it become marked that some companies with their headquarters in Shiga have developed their business activities into Kyoto since 1980's.
On the contrary, it is prominent that increasing number of companies with their headquarters located in Shiga have developed their business activities into Kyoto since 1980's.

sen.j: 2005年に滋賀県の「分権時代の県のあり方研究会」の報告書において、道州制の前段階として京都府と滋賀県の合併（京滋合併）が案のひとつに取り上げられたこともあった。
sen.e: A report published in 2005 by 'A Group That Researches Functions of Each Prefecture in the Age of Devolution of Power' in Shiga Prefecture picked up the merger plan of Kyoto and Shiga Prefectures (Keiji Merger) as one previous step before introducing the regional system.
sen.cmt: 「分権時代の県のあり方研究会」の正式英語名称が不明です。
sen.e: A report published in 2005 by 'Workshop for the functions of each prefecture in the age of devolution of power' in Shiga Prefecture picked up the merger plan of Kyoto and Shiga Prefectures (Keiji Merger) as one previous step before introducing the regional system.

A report published in 2005 by 'Workshop for the functions of each prefecture in the age of devolution of power' in Shiga Prefecture picked up the merger plan of Kyoto and Shiga Prefectures (Keiji Merger) as one previous step before introducing the regional system.

sen.j: さらに、京都の京、大津市の津から京津という呼称もある。
sen.e: There is another name, Kyotsu, that means Kyoto and Shiga; Kyo is from Kyoto, and Tsu from Otsu city.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処「京津」の読み方不明。Kyotsuとしました。
sen.e: There is another name, Kyotsu, that refers to Kyoto and Shiga; Kyo is from Kyoto, and Tsu from Otsu City.
There is another name, Kyotsu, that refers to Kyoto and Shiga; Kyo is from Kyoto, and Tsu from Otsu City.

sen.j: が、京滋と比較して使用されることが少ない。
sen.e: However, Keiji is more commonly used than Kyotsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Keiji is more commonly used than Kyotsu.
However, Keiji is more commonly used than Kyotsu.
